subject: Re: Where is the package org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner?
msgSnippet: Hey Dennis, thanks for the tip.  I downloaded JarIndexer and when I finally figured out you have to type in the entire package.class name it works great.  I
messageBody:
Hey Dennis, thanks for the tip. I downloaded JarIndexer and when I
finally figured out you have to type in the entire package.class name
it works great. I wish I'd known about this yesterday.

-Sam

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Dennis Lloyd Jr" <dennislloydjr@...>
wrote:
>
> I don't know where this JAR is, but when I have troubles like this,
I use a
> program called JarIndexer to search the JARs. It was a free
download last
> time I looked.
>
> On Thu, Aug 14, 2008 at 3:06 PM, Sam <sam.quiring@...> wrote:
>
> > I'm trying to write a custom JUnit test runner to be used in
Eclipse
> > (Ganymede). I have some questions about how things are working so
I
> > downloaded a huge amount of Eclipse and JUnit sources. I've found
a
> > lot of stuff, but I cannot find the classes that are in the
package
> > org.eclipse.jdt.internal.unit.runner (e.g., ITestIdentifier,
> > RemoteTestRunner).
> >
> > Does anyone know what Eclipse .jar file these sources are in?
> >
> > -Sam
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
